entry.name: Microsoft_Windows_Services_WinRM
entry.description: Tracks the State of Installed Services via WinRM/WMI including state, start mode, status, exit code, and service specific error code.
entry.wildcardgroovyscript:
<# © 2007-2020 - LogicMonitor, Inc. All rights reserved. #>
####################### Active Discovery ######################### # Purpose: # Author: #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Prerequisites: # # #Requires -Version 3 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Clears the CLI of any text Clear-Host # Clears memory of all previous variables Remove-Variable * -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Initialize Variables $WinRmUser = '##WINRM.USER##' $WinRmPass = '##WINRM.PASS##' $Hostname = '##SYSTEM.HOSTNAME##' $WinRMHttpPort = '##WINRM.HTTP.PORT##' $WinRMHttpsPort = '##WINRM.HTTPS.PORT##' $CollectorName = hostname
#Collect Auto Props set by Microsoft_PowerShell_WinRM_Info PS
$WinRMHTTPSEnabled = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTPS.ENABLED##' $WinRMHTTPEnabled = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTP.ENABLED##'
#If WINRM.HTTP/HTTPS.PORT is set use that value otherwise fallback to what was detected during PS detection If ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRMHttpsPort) -or ($WinRMHttpsPort -like '*WINRM.HTTPS.PORT*')) { $WinRMHTTPSPort = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTPS.PORT##' } If ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRMHttpPort) -or ($WinRMHttpPort -like '*WINRM.HTTP.PORT*')) { $WinRMHTTPPort = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTP.PORT##' }
# Resolve hostname IP/Name to FQDN for WinRM over https $Hostname = [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostEntry($Hostname).Hostname
#Set parameters $WSManParams = @{ ErrorAction = 'SilentlyContinue' Filter = 'SELECT NAME, DISPLAYNAME, STATE, STATUS, STARTMODE, EXITCODE, STARTED, SERVICESPECIFICEXITCODE, ERRORCONTROL FROM Win32_Service' ResourceURI = 'wmicimv2/*' Enumerate = $true }
#-----Determine the type of query to make----- # are WinRM user/pass props set -- e.g. are these device props either not substiuted or blank If (([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRmUser) -and [string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRmPass)) -or (($WinRmUser -like '*WINRM.USER*') -and ($WinRmPass -like '*WINRM.PASS*'))) { $WSManParams.ComputerName = $Hostname } Else { # yes. convert user/password into a credential string $RemotePass = ConvertTo-SecureString -String $WinRmPass -AsPlainText -Force; $RemoteCredential = New-Object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $WinRmUser, $RemotePass; $WSManParams.ComputerName = $Hostname $WSManParams.Authentication = 'default' $WSManParams.Credential = $RemoteCredential }
#Get configured WinRM HTTPS Port if configured If($WinRMHTTPSEnabled -eq $true){ $WSManParams.Port = $WinRMHttpsPort $WSManParams.UseSSL = $true } #Get configured WinRM HTTPS Port if configured ElseIf($WinRMHTTPEnabled -eq $true){ $WSManParams.Port = $WinRMHttpPort $WSManParams.UseSSL = $false } #WinRM not detected as being configured, quit processing any further Else{ Write-Host "WinRM is not detected as being enabled, please ensure winRM is configured and try again" Exit 1 }
#Attempt to get WMI results over WinRM $Result = Get-WSManInstance @WSManParams If($Result){ Foreach($Item in $Result){ $Wildvalue = $Item.Name Write-Host "$Wildvalue##$($Item.DisplayName)######auto.service.name=$($Item.Name)&auto.service.displayname=$($Item.DisplayName)&auto.service.state=$($Item.State)" } } Exit 0
entry.technology: Update the default Active Discovery filters to meet your requirements as the default settings will filter out all services except WinRM service to avoid spawning instances for all running services.
entry.adlist:
{"agdmethod":"none","method":"ad_script","agdparams":"","id":0,"filters":[{"attribute":"auto.service.displayname","operation":"Contain","value":"Windows Remote Management"},{"attribute":"auto.service.state","operation":"Equal","value":"Running"}],"params":{"type":"powerShell","groovyscript":"<# © 2007-2020 - LogicMonitor, Inc. All rights reserved. #>

####################### Active Discovery #########################
# Purpose:
# Author:
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Prerequisites:
#
#
#Requires -Version 3
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Clears the CLI of any text
Clear-Host
# Clears memory of all previous variables
Remove-Variable * -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
#------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Initialize Variables
$WinRmUser = '##WINRM.USER##'
$WinRmPass = '##WINRM.PASS##'
$Hostname = '##SYSTEM.HOSTNAME##'
$WinRMHttpPort = '##WINRM.HTTP.PORT##'
$WinRMHttpsPort = '##WINRM.HTTPS.PORT##'
$CollectorName = hostname

#Collect Auto Props set by Microsoft_PowerShell_WinRM_Info PS


$WinRMHTTPSEnabled = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTPS.ENABLED##'
$WinRMHTTPEnabled = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTP.ENABLED##'

#If WINRM.HTTP/HTTPS.PORT is set use that value otherwise fallback to what was detected during PS detection
If ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRMHttpsPort) -or ($WinRMHttpsPort -like '*WINRM.HTTPS.PORT*')) {
 $WinRMHTTPSPort = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTPS.PORT##'
}
If ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRMHttpPort) -or ($WinRMHttpPort -like '*WINRM.HTTP.PORT*')) {
 $WinRMHTTPPort = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTP.PORT##'
} 

# Resolve hostname IP/Name to FQDN for WinRM over https
$Hostname = [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostEntry($Hostname).Hostname

#Set parameters
$WSManParams = @{
 ErrorAction = 'SilentlyContinue'
 Filter = 'SELECT NAME, DISPLAYNAME, STATE, STATUS, STARTMODE, EXITCODE, STARTED, SERVICESPECIFICEXITCODE, ERRORCONTROL FROM Win32_Service'
 ResourceURI = 'wmicimv2/*'
 Enumerate = $true
}

#-----Determine the type of query to make-----
# are WinRM user/pass props set -- e.g. are these device props either not substiuted or blank
If (([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRmUser) -and [string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRmPass)) -or (($WinRmUser -like '*WINRM.USER*') -and ($WinRmPass -like '*WINRM.PASS*'))) {
 $WSManParams.ComputerName = $Hostname
} 
Else {
 # yes. convert user/password into a credential string
 $RemotePass = ConvertTo-SecureString -String $WinRmPass -AsPlainText -Force;
 $RemoteCredential = New-Object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $WinRmUser, $RemotePass;
 $WSManParams.ComputerName = $Hostname
 $WSManParams.Authentication = 'default'
 $WSManParams.Credential = $RemoteCredential
}

#Get configured WinRM HTTPS Port if configured
If($WinRMHTTPSEnabled -eq $true){
 $WSManParams.Port = $WinRMHttpsPort
 $WSManParams.UseSSL = $true
}
#Get configured WinRM HTTPS Port if configured
ElseIf($WinRMHTTPEnabled -eq $true){
 $WSManParams.Port = $WinRMHttpPort
 $WSManParams.UseSSL = $false
}
#WinRM not detected as being configured, quit processing any further
Else{
 Write-Host "WinRM is not detected as being enabled, please ensure winRM is configured and try again"
 Exit 1
}

#Attempt to get WMI results over WinRM
$Result = Get-WSManInstance @WSManParams
If($Result){
 Foreach($Item in $Result){
 $Wildvalue = $Item.Name
 Write-Host "$Wildvalue##$($Item.DisplayName)######auto.service.name=$($Item.Name)&auto.service.displayname=$($Item.DisplayName)&auto.service.state=$($Item.State)"
 }
}
Exit 0"}}

attribute.name: scriptgroovy
attribute.value:
<# © 2007-2020 - LogicMonitor, Inc. All rights reserved. #>
####################### Active Discovery ######################### # Purpose: # Author: #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Prerequisites: # # #Requires -Version 3 #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Clears the CLI of any text Clear-Host # Clears memory of all previous variables Remove-Variable * -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Initialize Variables $WinRmUser = '##WINRM.USER##' $WinRmPass = '##WINRM.PASS##' $Hostname = '##SYSTEM.HOSTNAME##' $WinRMHttpPort = '##WINRM.HTTP.PORT##' $WinRMHttpsPort = '##WINRM.HTTPS.PORT##' $CollectorName = hostname $WildValue = '##WILDVALUE##'
#Collect Auto Props set by Microsoft_PowerShell_WinRM_Info PS $WinRMHTTPSEnabled = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTPS.ENABLED##' $WinRMHTTPEnabled = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTP.ENABLED##'
$EnumState = @{ "Unknown" = 0 "Running" = 1 "Stopped" = 2 "Start Pending" = 3 "Stop Pending" = 4 "Continue Pending" = 5 "Pause Pending" = 6 "Paused" = 7 "Windows Server 2008" = 8 "Windows Vista" = 9 }
$EnumStatus = @{ "OK" = 1 "Service" = 2 "Degraded" = 3 "Pred Fail" = 4 "Lost Comm" = 5 "No Contact" = 6 }
$EnumStartmode = @{ "Disabled" = 0 "Auto" = 1 "Boot" = 2 "Manual" = 3 "System" = 4 }
$EnumErrorControl = @{ "Unknown" = 0 "Normal" = 1 "Ignore" = 2 "Severe" = 3 "Critical" = 4 }
#If WINRM.HTTP/HTTPS.PORT is set use that value otherwise fallback to what was detected during PS detection If ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRMHttpsPort) -or ($WinRMHttpsPort -like '*WINRM.HTTPS.PORT*')) { $WinRMHTTPSPort = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTPS.PORT##' } If ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRMHttpPort) -or ($WinRMHttpPort -like '*WINRM.HTTP.PORT*')) { $WinRMHTTPPort = '##AUTO.WINRM.HTTP.PORT##' }
# Resolve hostname IP/Name to FQDN for WinRM over https $Hostname = [System.Net.Dns]::GetHostEntry($Hostname).Hostname
#Set parameters $WSManParams = @{ ErrorAction = 'SilentlyContinue' Filter = "SELECT NAME, DISPLAYNAME, STATE, STATUS, STARTMODE, EXITCODE, STARTED, SERVICESPECIFICEXITCODE, ERRORCONTROL FROM Win32_Service WHERE NAME = `"$WildValue`"" ResourceURI = 'wmicimv2/*' Enumerate = $true }
#-----Determine the type of query to make----- # are WinRM user/pass props set -- e.g. are these device props either not substiuted or blank If (([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRmUser) -and [string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($WinRmPass)) -or (($WinRmUser -like '*WINRM.USER*') -and ($WinRmPass -like '*WINRM.PASS*'))) { $WSManParams.ComputerName = $Hostname } Else { # yes. convert user/password into a credential string $RemotePass = ConvertTo-SecureString -String $WinRmPass -AsPlainText -Force; $RemoteCredential = New-Object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $WinRmUser, $RemotePass; $WSManParams.ComputerName = $Hostname $WSManParams.Authentication = 'default' $WSManParams.Credential = $RemoteCredential }
#Get configured WinRM HTTPS Port if configured If($WinRMHTTPSEnabled -eq $true){ $WSManParams.Port = $WinRMHttpsPort $WSManParams.UseSSL = $true } #Get configured WinRM HTTPS Port if configured ElseIf($WinRMHTTPEnabled -eq $true){ $WSManParams.Port = $WinRMHttpPort $WSManParams.UseSSL = $false } #WinRM not detected as being configured, quit processing any further Else{ Write-Host "WinRM is not detected as being enabled, please ensure winRM is configured and try again" Exit 1 }
#Attempt to get WMI results over WinRM $Result = Get-WSManInstance @WSManParams If($Result){ Foreach($Item in $Result){ $Output = @() $Wildvalue = $Item.Name $Output = [PSCustomObject]@{ '##WILDVALUE##' = $WildValue State = $EnumState[$Item.State] Status = $EnumStatus[$Item.Status] StartMode = $EnumStartmode[$Item.StartMode] ErrorControl = $EnumErrorControl[$Item.ErrorControl] ExitCode = $Item.ExitCode ServiceSpecificErrorCode = $Item.ServiceSpecificExitCode Started = If ($Item.Started) {1} Else {0} }
$Output | ConvertTo-Json } } Exit 0

attribute.name: __filter_0
attribute.comment: Change filter to include/exclude required services

datapoint.name: AutomaticStart_NotRunning
datapoint.alertbody:
Microsoft Windows Services on ##HOST## is reporting a value of ##VALUE## for service ##INSTANCE##, this indicates that the service is set to an auto start method (Automatic, Automatic (Delayed Start), Automatic (Triggered Start)) and is not currently reporting running as it's state placing the host into ##LEVEL## state.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
For alerting on Auto StartMode services only. Valid if the service is set to automatic and is not running.
Reports 1 for services that are reporting "auto, boot, manual or system"as their start mode via WMI but are not reporting running in state i.e (stopped, paused, start pending, continue pending, pause pending, paused, windows server 2000, windows vista).
Reports 0 if the services is "auto" and state is running.
Thresholds are not set by default due to considerations for delayed/triggered services noted below.
Recommended Alert Threshold by service instance start mode:
For Automatic (!= 1 1) with 0-2 consecutive polls
For Automatic (Delayed Start) (!= 1 1) with 7-10 consecutive polls
For Automatic (Triggered Start) (no alert threshold)
While it is useful to alert on running status for most automatic mode services that are not reporting OK in state ASAP, every environment is different and each service may not need to monitor data and alert on this condition so no default threshold is set.

datapoint.name: DisabledStart_Running
datapoint.alertbody:
Microsoft Windows Services on ##HOST## is reporting a value of ##VALUE## for service ##INSTANCE##, this indicates that the service is set to the disabled start method and is currently reporting running as it's state placing the host into ##LEVEL## state.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
For alerting on disabled StartMode services only. Valid if the service is set to disabled and is running.
Output is 1 if a service that has it's startup type set to disabled but is running.
Reports 0 if if the services is disabled and state is not running.
If the service is set to disabled and is running you can use this complex datapoint to trigger an alert.
Thresholds are not set by default due to considerations noted below.
Recommended Alert Threshold by service instance start mode:
(= 1 1)
While it is useful to alert on running status for most disabled mode services that are reporting OK in state ASAP, every environment is different and each service may not need to monitor data and alert on this condition so no default threshold is set.

datapoint.name: ErrorControl
datapoint.description:
Error severity level
Status Code: Unknown = 0 Normal = 1 Ignore = 2 Severe = 3 Critical = 4

datapoint.name: ServiceSpecificErrorCode
datapoint.description: Service Specific Error Code for Service

datapoint.name: StartMode
datapoint.description:
Start mode reported by a service
Status Code: Disabled = 0 Auto = 1 Boot = 2 Manual = 3 System = 4

datapoint.name: Started
datapoint.description:
Started State:
Status Code True = 1 False = 0

datapoint.name: State
datapoint.alertbody:
Microsoft Windows Services on ##HOST## is reporting that ##INSTANCE## is showing a value for State of ##VALUE##, this indicates an unknown state placing the host into ##LEVEL## state.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
datapoint.description:
State of a Windows service.
Status Code: Unknown = 0 Running = 1 Stopped = 2 Start Pending = 3 Stop Pending = 4 Continue Pending = 5 Pause Pending = 6 Paused = 7 Windows Server 2008 = 8 Windows Vista = 9

datapoint.name: Status
datapoint.alertbody:
Microsoft Windows Service on ##HOST## for instance ##INSTANCE## is reporting a value of ##VALUE##, placing the host into ##LEVEL## state.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
Status Code: OK = 1 Service = 2 Degraded = 3 Pred Fail = 4 Lost Comm = 5 No Contact = 6
Note on Service = 2: (Could apply during mirror-resilvering of a disk, reload of a user permissions list, or other administrative work. Not all such work is online, yet the managed element is neither "OK" nor in one of the other states.)
datapoint.description:
Status of a Windows service.
Status Code: Ok = 1 Service = 2 Degraded = 3 Pred Fail = 4 Lost Comm = 5 No Contact = 6
